TextBody:
Hi Harald,

Thanks for reaching out!

Is this happening for one or more computers? Can those computers ping the server's IP?

Could you please also check if you have enough licenses in System Configuration -> System licensing and send a screenshot?

Please send the following screenshot of the EPP client:
In order to check if the client is communicating with the server, please follow these instructions:
1. Open the EPP client and go to the Settings tab
2. Hit the following button combination depending on what OS you’re on:
- Windows: ctrl + alt + i
- MacOS: option + command + i
3. If the client is communicating with the server, the Server IP and Port will show the IP and the port, and it will show as connected. It will also show when the time of the last server connection


Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.
